definitions.definition: To wheedle or persuade (a person, organisation, animal etc.) gradually or by use of flattery to do something.
examples: He coaxed the horse gently into the trailer.

definitions.definition: To carefully manipulate (someone or something) into a particular desired state, situation or position.
examples: They coaxed the rope through the pipe.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To fondle , kid, pet, tease .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To wheedle or persuade (a person, organisation, animal etc.) gradually or by use of flattery to do something.
( transitive ) To carefully manipulate (someone or something) into a particular desired state, situation or position.
